title: How to use `describe_change`
text: describe_change function provides straightforward way describe numerical changes two values (). function flexible, allowing different ways express change, using percentages, ratios, numbers, can customized templates phrasing. vignette demonstrates use describe_change function various scenarios, including basic usage, custom phrasing, custom templates.

title: How to use `describe_change`
text: describe change two numeric values, can call describe_change initial value (), new value (), specify type input output units. example: example, input values treated ratios (e.g., 1 represents 100%, 0.5 represents 50%), output expressed percentage.
code: # Describing a percentage decrease describe_change(   before = 1,   after = 0.5,   input_unit = "ratio",   output_unit = "percent" ) #> decreased by 50 percent

title: How to use `describe_change`
text: want include initial () new () values output, set include_values argument TRUE. can useful want provide context description. setting include_values = TRUE, output now includes original values, offering detailed information change.
code: # Including before and after values in the description describe_change(   before = 100,   after = 120,   input_unit = "number",   output_unit = "number",   include_values = TRUE ) #> increased by 20, from 100 to 120

title: How to use `describe_change`
text: can customize function expresses increases, decreases, changes providing direction_phrases argument. argument allows specify phrasing case. , used "rose " increases "fell " decreases instead default "increased " "decreased ".
code: # Custom phrasing for increase and decrease describe_change(   before = 33,   after = 66,   input_unit = "percent",   output_unit = "percent",   direction_phrases = c(     increase = "rose by",     decrease = "fell by",     none = "stagnated"   ) ) #> rose by 100 percent

title: How to use `describe_change`
text: describe_change function supports custom templates via template argument. can include placeholders {direction}, {change}, {unit} dynamically insert values final description. template argument gives complete control output format, making function adaptable various use cases.
code: # Custom template for describing the change in people describe_change(   before = 10,   after = 12,   input_unit = "number",   output_unit = "number",   template = "{direction} {change} people" ) #> increased by 2 people

title: How to use `describe_change`
text: function designed handle common edge cases, initial new values : case, function returns message indicating change.
code: # No change in values describe_change(   before = 50,   after = 50,   input_unit = "number",   output_unit = "number" ) #> remained unchanged

title: How to use `describe_change`
text: describe_change function ensures combination input_unit output_unit valid given values. example, certain combinations require value non-zero. invalid combination detected, error raised: helps prevent issues like divide--zero errors, especially working percentages ratios. function guide toward valid input output unit selections.
code: # Invalid combination where 'before' is zero and output unit is 'percent' describe_change(   before = 0,   after = 10,   input_unit = "number",   output_unit = "percent" ) #> Error in `describe_change()`: #> ! 'before' cannot be zero for the given input/output unit combination.

title: How to use `describe_change`
text: describe_change function flexible tool describing numerical changes. Whether ’re working percentages, ratios, raw numbers, function provides clear, customizable descriptions changes two values. ability modify templates direction phrases makes function adaptable various contexts, simple percentage changes complex descriptions require including specific units values. advanced usage customization, refer function’s documentation examples.

title: Creating New OJO Projects
text: ojo_create_project() function provides standardized way create new R projects Open Justice Oklahoma. sets project standard directory structure, initializes version control, configures common dependencies.

title: Creating New OJO Projects
text: simplest way create new project provide name description: : Create new GitHub repository template Clone local machine Initialize renv dependency management Set basic README content Make initial commit push GitHub
code: ojo_create_project(   name = "my-new-project",   description = "A project to analyze court data" )

title: Creating New OJO Projects
text: name: name project (required) description: brief description project dir: create project (defaults current directory) private: Whether GitHub repository private (defaults TRUE) packages: Additional R packages install (yet implemented)

title: Creating New OJO Projects
text: ’s example using available parameters:
code: ojo_create_project(   name = "court-data-analysis",   description = "Analysis of Oklahoma court data for 2023",   dir = "~/projects",   private = TRUE )

title: Creating New OJO Projects
text: use function, need: GitHub account access OpenJusticeOK organization SSH keys configured GitHub

title: Creating New OJO Projects
text: get authentication errors, make sure GitHub SSH keys properly configured Project names follow R package naming conventions (letters, numbers, hyphens)

title: Creating New OJO Projects
text: following features planned: Interactive CLI project creation Support custom project templates Additional project configuration options Package dependency management

title: Authors and Citation
text: Brancen Gregory. Author, maintainer. Andrew Bell. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Gregory B, Bell (2025). ojoutils: Collection Nifty Functions Objects OJO Analysts. R package version 0.1.3, https://openjusticeok.github.io/ojoutils/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ojoutils: A Collection of Nifty Functions and Objects for OJO Analysts},   author = {Brancen Gregory and Andrew Bell},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.3},   url = {https://openjusticeok.github.io/ojoutils/}, }

title: Describe Change — describe_change
text: Generate descriptive statements changes two values.

title: Describe Change — describe_change
code: describe_change(   before,   after,   input_unit,   output_unit,   template = NULL,   direction_phrases = c(increase = "increased by", decrease = "decreased by", none =     "remained unchanged"),   include_values = FALSE )

title: Describe Change — describe_change
text: initial numeric value compare. unit combinations must non-zero avoid divide--zero errors. numeric value compare initial value. input_unit One "number", "percent", "ratio". Determines values treated. output_unit One "number", "percent", "times", "points". "points" may used input_unit "percent" "ratio". template {glue} template string returned change. Defaults provided based output_unit. Possible template variables : direction, change, unit. direction_phrases named vector three items: "increase", "decrease", "none", used customize either default custom template. include_values logical value indicating whether include change description string.

title: Describe Change — describe_change
text: string describing change two values, optionally including values .

title: Describe Change — describe_change
code: # Basic usage with defaults describe_change(   before = 1,   after = 0.5,   input_unit = "ratio",   output_unit = "percent", ) #> decreased by 50 percent #> decreased by 50 percent  # Using different phrasing for changes describe_change(   before = 33,   after = 66,   input_unit = "percent",   output_unit = "percent",   direction_phrases = c(     increase = "rose by",     decrease = "fell by",     none = "stagnated"   ) ) #> rose by 100 percent #> rose by 100 percent  # Customizing the template describe_change(   before = 10,   after = 12,   input_unit = "number",   output_unit = "number",   template = "{direction} {change} people" ) #> increased by 2 people #> increased by 2 people

title: Directory Empty? — dir_empty
text: Takes path determines whether empty.

title: Directory Empty? — dir_empty
text: path relative absolute path directory test.

title: Directory Empty? — dir_empty
text: TRUE directory empty, otherwise FALSE. directory exist, string supplied path recognized valid path, function returns error.

title: Limit — limit
text: thin wrapper around head sooth pain context switching R SQL

title: Limit — limit
text: x object limit ... Additional arguments head

title: Limit — limit
text: limited object

title: Limit — limit
text: thin wrapper around head allows limit used place head. useful sometimes hard context switch R SQL. can used lazy data frames since package imports dbplyr.

title: Oklahoma Counties — ojo_counties
text: Oklahoma Counties

title: Oklahoma Counties — ojo_counties
text: object class character length 77.

title: Create Project — ojo_create_project
text: Creates new R project standard directory structure

title: Create Project — ojo_create_project
code: ojo_create_project(   name = NULL,   description = NULL,   dir = ".",   private = TRUE,   packages = NULL )

title: Create Project — ojo_create_project
text: learn creating projects, see vignette: vignette("project-creation", package = "ojotools")

title: Parse Oklahoma Counties — ojo_parse_county
text: Parse Oklahoma Counties

title: Parse Oklahoma Counties — ojo_parse_county
code: ojo_parse_county(   county,   ...,   case = "lower",   squish = NULL,   suffix = NULL,   counties = ojo_counties,   .silent = FALSE )

title: Parse Oklahoma Counties — ojo_parse_county
text: county string character vector represents Oklahoma county ... Placeholder future arguments case case format county string . One "lower", "upper", "title". squish boolean indicator whether remove whitespace suffix Specification suffix remove item county. example, " County, OK". counties vector valid county names match . .silent currently unused argument.

what: Function to use the OJO quarto HTML template — ojo_use_template
title: Function to use the OJO quarto HTML template — ojo_use_template
text: Wrapper quarto use template command. Defaults OJO html template.

title: Function to use the OJO quarto HTML template — ojo_use_template
Function to use the OJO quarto HTML template — ojo_use_template
text: path name directory template added. string representing absolute path, path relative current working directory. template name Quarto template use. string format "username/repository". Default "openjusticeok/ojo-report-template".

title: Function to use the OJO quarto HTML template — ojo_use_template
text: function return value. user chooses proceed operation, function exits silently.

title: Function to use the OJO quarto HTML template — ojo_use_template

text: Maintainer: Brancen Gregory brancengregory@gmail.com Authors: Andrew Bell abell@okpolicy.org

title: ojoutils 0.1.2 (2024-03-12)
text: Adds ojo_use_template function make easier add new blank Quarto report project repository. Adds dir_empty, styled fs fashion, easily check whether directory , well, empty.

title: ojoutils 0.1.1 (2023-07-08)
text: Adds ojo_parse_county function standardizing Oklahoma county names, optionally specifying case result. Adds ojo_counties object vector Oklahoma county names lowercase. also used internally ojo_parse_county.

title: ojoutils 0.1.0 (2023-07-07)
text: Adds function limit works like head helpful brain SQL mode.
